prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 1
Name: Florence Niedler
Description: A nurse who works at Hertz Hospital. Has a worrying tendency to offer unnecessary treatments to everyone she meets.
Character 2
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A mysterious young woman brought to the High Prosecutors' Offices by Florence Niedler. She appears to have lost her memory, but...
Character 3
Name: Hilda Hertz
Description: The head of Hertz Hospital. Carried out the preliminary inspection of the victim in this case.
Character 4
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. She is a highly talented prosecutor, and is currently working with Interpol.
Character 5
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: The greatest prosecutor ever to prosecute... according to himself, anyway. In actual fact, his relationship with logic is tenuous at best.
Character 6
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 7
Name: Rosie Ringer
Description: The victim in this case. She was a defense attorney, and served on the Committee alongside Judge Gavèlle.
Character 8
Name: Excelsius Winner
Description: Former chief prosecutor, current Chairman of the Committee, and Eustace Winner's father. Has a tendency to burst into tears over nothing.
Character 9
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: Senior partner at Edgeworth and Co. He's trying to get me to become a defense attorney.
Character 10
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A high school student looking to become a forensic investigator, and the younger sister of my former boss.
Character 11
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: A freelance photojournalist who I've met in the past. Known for her ability to sniff out scoops and snap them with her trusty camera.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Yatagarasu Pin
Description: The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears.
Evidence 2
Name: Jammin' Ninja Mask
Description: A mask modeled on the Jammin' Ninja's face. Made of cheap plastic.
Evidence 3
Name: Letter
Description: A letter Kay was carrying. It is addressed to her.
Evidence 4
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: A book of promises Kay made to her father when she was a little girl. What was it doing in the Committee chamber?
Evidence 5
Name: Ticket Stub
Description: Stub from a ticket granting entry to the viewing platform on top of the Bigg Building.
Evidence 6
Name: Magenta Flower
Description: A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Also known as a corsage. A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Torn from the victim's clothes.
Evidence 7
Name: Bigg Building Pamphlet
Description: Contains a cross-section of the building and a plan of the viewing platform. [caption] On the roof is the viewing platform. Beneath is a storeroom on the 51th floor, and the P.I.C meeting room on the 50th floor. On a top-down view of the viewing platform on the roof, to the left-most edge is a cherry tree. To the right-most edge is a candy stand.
Evidence 8
Name: Kay's Recollections
Description: Kay remembers a person coming from beyond the concession stand and pushing her off of the building.
Evidence 9
Name: Candelabrum
Description: A three-armed candle holder that may have been the murder weapon, judging by the wounds to the the victim's chest. A three-armed candle holder found by the victim's body. Made to look like the murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Keycard
Description: A keycard that grants entry to the Committee chamber. Found in the victim's hand.
Evidence 11
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Initial findings of Dr. Hilda Hertz. Cause of death: Stab wounds to left chest. Head injury sustained post mortem. Death occurred as a result of a heavy blow to the head with a circular object. Chest wounds inflicted post-mortem.
Evidence 12
Name: Keycard Record
Description: Record of keycards used to enter the Committee chamber.
Evidence 13
Name: Victim's Letter
Description: A letter that appears to have been written to the victim by Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Broken Plushie
Description: The stuffed animal we originally found in the Zheng Fa presidential plane. Missing its left horn. Fitted with a recording device that captured part of a conversation. One of the people recorded had a prominent burn.
Evidence 15
Name: Masks
Description: A selection of various masks was kept on a rack. Each participant in the auction wore one.
Evidence 16
Name: Ringleader's Appearance
Description: Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Age and gender could not be discerned. Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Also had a tattoo on the part of their face the mask didn't cover.
Evidence 17
Name: Ms. Hart's Picture
Description: A photograph of the mysterious figure in the red raincoat. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Ms. Hart's Statement
Description: Ms. Hart's observations about what happened during the mysterious auction.
Evidence 19
Name: Elevator Blood
Description: Blood was detected on the secret elevator. It looks like it dripped through to the floor below.
Evidence 20
Name: Clothes Box
Description: Box in which the killer hid the body. Traces of blood were detected inside.
Evidence 21
Name: Committee Chamber Blood
Description: Blood found in the Committee chamber. Was it placed there to hide the existence of the storeroom?
Evidence 22
Name: Red Raincoat
Description: Worn by the victim, whose fingerprints and blood were found on the hood.
Evidence 23
Name: Nurse Niedler's Statement
Description: Niedler's description of how she swapped places with Rosie Ringer.
Evidence 24
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Details of a murder case from eighteen years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Did I... really come to a place like this?
Person: Kay
Testimony 1
Testimony: It's so high up, and the wind is so strong... It's frightening.
Person: Kay
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I just can't remember. I can't remember anything at all...
Person: Kay
Testimony 3
Testimony: But... from under the cherry tree... I feel like... I saw something red.
Person: Kay
Testimony 4
Testimony: Umm... That's right, someone was walking towards me from the other side of that stand.
Person: Kay
Testimony 5
Testimony: .....I'm sorry. Just as I thought, it's impossible.
Person: Kay

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 8 (Kay's Recollections) states that Kay "remembers a person coming from beyond the concession stand and pushing her off of the building."

Testimony 3 from Kay says, "... from under the cherry tree... I feel like... I saw something red."

In Evidence 7 (Bigg Building Pamphlet), the cherry tree is located at the left-most edge of the viewing platform, while the concession stand is at the right-most edge. If Kay was pushed from beyond the concession stand, it should be on that side, but in her testimony she mentions the cherry tree and something red, which contradicts where she said the person was coming from in the evidence.

Thus, Evidence 8 and Testimony 3 contradict each other regarding the location and details of the event.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I am the best in the world. No one else can do what I do.
Person: Debeste
Testimony 1
Testimony: Yes! That's why I was the first to realize that Kay Faraday is the culprit!
Person: Debeste
Testimony 2
Testimony: She broke into the meeting room in order to steal something.
Person: Debeste
Testimony 3
Testimony: In other words, she's the only one who could have killed Ms. Crane!
Person: Debeste

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 11 (Autopsy Report) states that the cause of death was a heavy blow to the head with a circular object, and chest wounds were inflicted post-mortem. This means the victim was already dead when chest wounds were made.

Testimony 2 by Debeste claims "She broke into the meeting room in order to steal something," implying a motive related to theft which may have occurred before the killing, but doesn't directly contradict the autopsy.

Testimony 1 and Testimony 3 by Debeste accuse Kay Faraday as the culprit and claim that she is the only one who could have killed Ms. Crane (presumably the victim Rosie Ringer), which suggests premeditation or direct murder by stabbing or other means.

Given that the chest wounds were post-mortem, it means that stabbing could not have been the cause of death, but the testimony suggests culpability tied to an action (possibly stabbing) done by Kay Faraday.

Therefore, Testimony 3 ("In other words, she's the only one who could have killed Ms. Crane!") contradicts the autopsy findings that the victim was killed by a heavy blow to the head and not by chest wounds.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: Evidence 3 is a letter that Kay was carrying, addressed to her. Testimony 4 states that Ms. Crane tucked safely away a letter in her left breast pocket as a parting gift before she died. This could suggest that the letter in Evidence 3 was originally on Ms. Crane, not Kay, contradicting the implication that Kay was carrying the letter herself.
